headline: Love is not a straight river
description: A poetic meditation on love's aftermath—on breaking, growth, and the bittersweet promise that pain can yield transformation.

fieldDefinitions.resonantThread: From ruin, something sacred may grow.
fieldDefinitions.whyItMatters: This piece speaks to the emotional honesty required to acknowledge damage done in a relationship, while holding space for the possibility of renewal without reconciliation.

fieldDefinitions.articleExcerpt: I loved her so much / I had to let her go / I broke her / she broke me / And apart both shall grow...
